intro: Lipschitziella, commonly known as the common lipschitziella, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage, which are typical features of the carrot family. The plants typically grow in temperate regions and are often found in grassy areas or along forest edges. They have a shallow root system and are relatively drought-tolerant. The flowers are small and white or pale in color, contributing to their ornamental value in gardens.
